forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind 3 to 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Slight Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 3 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night settles over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries the scent of impending rain, mingling with the freshness of the coastal breeze. The clouds hang low, wrapping the city in a soft, gray shroud, while the temperature sits comfortably around 56 degrees. If you’re taking a stroll tonight, a light jacket or umbrella will serve you well, for the forecast hints at rain likely, with a 70% chance of a few droplets gracing the pavement as the night deepens. Though the wind is gentle, the atmosphere feels charged with anticipation.

Tomorrow brings a subtle shift in the weather. A slight chance of rain lingers in the late afternoon, with a high of 62 degrees, gradually cooling towards an unsettling yet cozy 60. The clouds will continue to dominate the skyline, but a sense of calm accompanies the day, less oppressive than the night. For those venturing out, consider layering your clothing—a light sweater under your jacket will be just right for unpredictable moments. It's a day that invites quiet reflection, perhaps wandering through a nearby café with a good book or indulging in a leisurely visit to the bustling Ferry Building Marketplace, all perfectly suited to the rhythm of a chilly yet invigorating San Francisco day.
